TopicTitle: [0.14-0.16] Kessler: asynchronous, shared-world multiplayer (+ save editor)

Articles.Content: My favorite part is the kessler save editor!

When ever i try to run a server and a client (I'm doing thins for a buddy) it says:

Synchronizing save file with server...

Found Java at C:\Program Files\Java\jre7

Connecting to localhost:8988...

Server ready.

Uploading saves/default/persistent.sfs to server for merge...

---- BEGIN STACK TRACE ----

java.io.FileNotFoundException: saves\default\persistent.sfs (The system cannot f

ind the path specified)

at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method)

at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source)

at scala.io.Source$.fromFile(Source.scala:91)

at scala.io.Source$.fromFile(Source.scala:76)

at scala.io.Source$.fromFile(Source.scala:54)

at kessler.KesslerClient.putGame(KesslerClient.scala:61)

at kessler.KesslerClient.syncGame(KesslerClient.scala:53)

at kessler.KesslerClient$.main(KesslerClient.scala:177)

at kessler.KesslerClient.main(KesslerClient.scala)

---- END STACK TRACE ----

Unhandled error executing Kessler client!

Please report this as a bug. There is a copy of this message in kessler/client_l

og.txt.

Press enter to continue...

When ever i try to run a server and a client (I'm doing thins for a buddy) it says:

You definitely have a persistent.sfs in your KSP\saves\default\ directory?

Where are you running this program from? Looks like it expects to be run from KSP\...
I really hope that the editor gets updated to 0.17, I want to be able to test landers before doing the whole trip
I hate manually setting my orbit with launching it but I guess it will have to do until it updates.

What is causing this error? (full log here: http://pastebin.com/1EuXJevj)

Applying filter 'nan'

Applying filter 'ghost'

---- BEGIN STACK TRACE ----

java.util.NoSuchElementException: key not found: UT

at scala.collection.MapLike$class.default(MapLike.scala:224)

at scala.collection.mutable.LinkedHashMap.default(LinkedHashMap.scala:48

)

at scala.collection.MapLike$class.apply(MapLike.scala:135)

Will a future version of Kessler include a 'full-share' option so that ALL changes are shared, allways.

So that I can actually crash my friends MIR replica into the mun, if I want to.

I'm going to protect my server with a password anyway, and the group I will play with are all trusted friends, some of us would like to be able to catch&deorbit other people's debris for example.
Does the Kessler server thingy work with .17? From previous posts I'd assume the editor doesn't work, but does the file sharing service work?
Is there a server wich is real time, too??

Is this working for .17?

This is what I want to know.
ToxicFrog, will you please update this for 0.17? There are some people out there that don't know how to set orbits manually! So can you please update KESSLER? So we can all explore other planets?
I saw this and my jaw dropped into my lap. OMG! Keep up the good work!

Does it work for .21? I have a rover with a couple of crooked wheels in orbit around Minmus that I want to swap out for the one I fixed.

Edit: Decided to try it and it claims I don't have Java and it doesn't find the save file either.

Edited October 15, 2013 by Galane

It`s been over a year since the OP has posted here when people were calling for an update for 0.17...

I think this may be a dead mod...

I made a hamachi network for hosting kessler servers, can I have it added to thread?

Network name:KSP Kessler

No password for hamachi network.

I am also hosting one with default port, no password and it is debris free along other misc filters.
Mate. Read the opening post, the title, anything. This is a mod for version 0.14-0.16 this is a completely dead mod. Go use KMP.

Can someone... lock this up Vista style?

Because it locks up, get it?
